profile.topo_creator_subtitle: Topo generation in just a few clicks.
profile.topo_creator_description: Create and edit topos directly in your browser. Our topo creator is optimized for desktop use and is not yet well suited for mobile devices.
profile.feedback_explanation: Do you have suggestions to improve the app or want to propose new features? Share your feedback via email and help us make Canyon Explore even better.
profile.support_explanation: Need help using the app or running into technical issues? Contact our support team via email and we'll be happy to assist.
profile.contact_explanation: Have questions or ideas? Reach out to us via email and we'll gladly help.

faqs.title: FAQs
faqs.faq_purpose_q: What is the purpose of this app?
faqs.faq_purpose_a: This app is designed to help canyoning enthusiasts plan and navigate their trips effortlessly. From access routes and parking to offline maps and topographies, it's your ultimate canyoning companion.
faqs.faq_devices_a: The app is available for both Android and iOS devices. It works best on smartphones but is also compatible with tablets.
faqs.faq_languages_q: In which languages is the app available?
faqs.faq_languages_a: The app currently supports English, German, Spanish, Italian, Portuguese, and French. If you'd like to see additional languages, feel free to contact us.
faqs.faq_offline_q: Can I use the app offline?
faqs.faq_offline_a: Yes, you can download canyon information, maps, and topographies for offline use. This ensures you have everything you need, even when you're off the grid.
faqs.faq_access_routes_q: What format does the app support for access routes?
faqs.faq_access_routes_a: The app uses tracks on a included offline map to display access routes on the map, leading you directly to canyon starting points and parking lots.
faqs.faq_new_canyons_q: Will new canyons be added regularly?
faqs.faq_new_canyons_a: Yes! We're continually expanding our database with new canyons. Updates will be rolled out frequently to keep the app fresh and useful.
faqs.faq_edit_canyon_q: Can I edit an existing canyon?
faqs.faq_edit_canyon_a: Yes. By clicking on >Edit Canyon<, you can submit an improved version of an existing canyon. Our team will review your submission and publish it as soon as possible.
faqs.faq_add_canyon_q: Can I add my own canyon to the app?
faqs.faq_add_canyon_a: Absolutely! You can add a canyon via >Add Canyon< and provide all the necessary data. This should include a description, access tracks, and a topo. Once submitted, we'll review and publish it as quickly as possible.
faqs.faq_topo_format_q: What format should I use for the topo?
faqs.faq_topo_format_a: The topo can simply be a photo you take. Our team will then convert it into the Canyon Explore format so that it integrates seamlessly into the app.
faqs.faq_topo_creator_q: Is there a topo creator in the app?
faqs.faq_topo_creator_a: Not yet. Currently, you need to provide an existing topo (e.g. as a photo). However, we are working on a topo editor tool that will allow you to create and customize topos directly within Canyon Explore.
faqs.faq_publish_time_q: How long does it take until my submitted canyon or edit is published?
faqs.faq_publish_time_a: We usually review and publish new or updated canyons within a few days. The exact time may vary depending on the complexity and completeness of the data.
faqs.faq_share_trips_q: Can I share my canyoning trips with others?
faqs.faq_share_trips_a: Yes! You can post that you completed a canyon and add a short report about the current circumstances (e.g., water level, obstacles, safety conditions). This helps other users get up-to-date information and makes the community stronger.
faqs.faq_new_features_q: Can I suggest new features for the app?
faqs.faq_new_features_a: Yes, we'd love to hear your ideas! You can send your suggestions through the in-app feedback form. Your input helps us shape the future of Canyon Explore.
faqs.faq_report_issues_q: Can I report errors or suggest new canyons to add?
faqs.faq_report_issues_a: Absolutely! We value your feedback. You can report issues or suggest new canyons directly through the app's feedback section or by emailing us.

There is no topo available yet for this canyon section.
Help us complete the data and send us a topo for this section.

Also try our topo creator at
topo-creator.canyon-explore.com
to create your own topo! It is optimized for use on a computer.
details.no_comments_yet: No comment yet for this section. Be the first one to add a comment!
details.comment_thanks_text: We have received your comment and will publish it as soon as possible.
details.official_partner_description: Some of our canyons are presented by official partners. There you can find all the details, including topos, approaches, and much more. Discover the canyons in the book and dive even deeper into the adventure!

rating.title: Subjective User Rating for this Canyon Section
rating.description: The rating is based on the average of all user ratings. It is a subjective measure of how good the canyon is.

anchorQuality.title: Quality of Anchoring
anchorQuality.description: Rates the condition and reliability of installed anchors, including bolts, fixed ropes, and other safety points. A good quality rating indicates well-placed, and well-maintained anchors, while a lower rating may suggest aging or poorly maintained equipment.

index.title: Index and Number of Sections in this Canyon
index.description: The number on the left shows the current section index within the canyon, while the number on the right indicates the total number of sections in the entire canyon.

durationCanyon.title: Duration in Canyon
durationCanyon.description: This is the estimated time required to complete this section of the canyon without the approach and return hikes. The duration depends on factors like group size, experience, water flow, and technical challenges.

difficulty.title: Difficulty
difficulty.description:
The difficulty is shown in the French system (e.g., v3 a4 II).

Vertical Difficulty (v):
Rates the technical difficulty of rappels and downclimbs. A higher number (scale goes from 1 to 7) indicates longer rappels, more complex ropework, and greater exposure.

Aquatic Difficulty (a):
Rates the challenges posed by water features in the canyon. A higher number (scale goes from 1 to 7) indicates stronger currents, mandatory jumps, technical slides, siphons, or difficult swimming passages.

Commitment (roman number):
Rates the difficulty of retreating or exiting the canyon. A higher number (scale goes from I to VI) indicates longer total duration, fewer escape options, and greater exposure to environmental risks.

highestRappel.title: Highest Rappel
highestRappel.description: The height of the longest rappel (abseil) in the canyon section. This measurement helps determine the required rope length.

access_no.title: Approach Duration (Without a Shuttle Car)
access_no.description: Refers to the estimated time required to reach the entrance of the canyon section from the parking lot, assuming you don't have a second car for shuttle.

exit_no.title: Return Duration (Without a Shuttle Car)
exit_no.description: Refers to the estimated time required to hike back to the parking lot after completing the section of the canyon, assuming no second car is available for shuttle.

recommendedRopes.title: Recommended Ropes
recommendedRopes.description:
Indicates the recommended rope length(s) for the canyon, based on the height of the rappels and technical requirements. This ensures you have sufficient rope to complete the descents safely and effectively.
However, this ist just a recommandation and may vary depending on specific conditions. Always assess the situation on-site before proceeding and ask local guides.

access_yes.title: Approach Duration (With a Shuttle Car)
access_yes.description: Refers to the estimated time required to reach the entrance of the canyon section from the parking lot, assuming you have a second car for shuttle.

exit_yes.title: Return Duration (With a Shuttle Car)
exit_yes.description: Refers to the estimated time required to hike back to the parking lot after completing the section of the canyon, assuming a second car is available for shuttle.

horizontalLength.title: Horizontal Length
horizontalLength.description: Indicates the total horizontal distance you will cover within this section of the canyon.

elevation_start.title: Elevation at the Entrance
elevation_start.description: Refers to the altitude of this section's starting point in the canyon. It is measured above sea level.

elevation_end.title: Elevation at the Exit
elevation_end.description: Refers to the altitude of this section's end point in the canyon. It is measured above sea level.

elevation_difference.title: Elevation Difference between Entrance and Exit
elevation_difference.description: Describes the vertical difference in elevation from the entrance to the exit of the section in the canyon. This difference helps determine the overall descent, providing an insight into the canyon's steepness and the effort required for the descent.

filter.title: Filter
filter.warning_text_min_max: Make sure that the left selector has a lower value than the right selector.

duration.title: Duration
duration.shuttleCar_description_yes: A shuttle car is available. So all the durations listed below are assuming that you have at least two cars.
duration.shuttleCar_description_no: A shuttle car is not available. So all the durations listed below are assuming that you have only one car.
